snippet.title: Using GitHub Copilot to Document a Project
snippet.description:
In this demonstration I am using GitHub Copilot Edits to create document from the Codebase.

The documentation contains information about Database and Schema (ERD), UML diagram, and Web navigation, and all these generated with a simple prompt.

snippet.title: Discover GitHub Copilot Agent Mode in Action! üöÄ
snippet.description:
In this video, watch as I demonstrate the power of GitHub Copilot's new Agent Mode while tackling a common developer challenge: setting up Next.js internationalization. 

With this revolutionary mode, all I need to do is ask, validate, and let Copilot handle the rest‚Äîautomating and explaining every step of the process!

See how effortlessly it works and imagine how it could simplify your workflow. Curious? 

Try it out yourself in VSCode Insider and share your experience in the comments! 

Let‚Äôs explore the future of AI-assisted development together. üåü

snippet.title: Copilot Next Edit Suggestions in action
snippet.description:
See how Copilot Next Edit Suggestions is helping me to add a new parameter to to a TypeScript function.

This feature is available as preview in VSCode 1.97 see : https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_97#_copilot-next-edit-suggestions-preview

snippet.title: ü§® Cannot remember a terminal command ? üòè Just ask #Copilot in #VSCode terminal !
snippet.description:
When I cannot remember which command to run, I simply use GitHub Copilot in the terminal!

For example here, when I could not remember how to run my #Playwright tests

snippet.title: Effortlessly Adding Strings in 4 Languages to Next.js i18n with GitHub Copilot Edits
snippet.description: In this video, I demonstrate how to use GitHub Copilot Edits to streamline updates to Next.js internationalization (i18n) files. Watch as I effortlessly add new entries for "login" and "logout" in four languages: English, Spanish, German, and French. See how AI makes multilingual app development faster and easier!

snippet.title: Using GitHub Copilot to Refactor a SpringBoot Controller
snippet.description:
See how GitHub Copilot Edits can help you refactoring code of your Java application:
- exctracting DB calls into a new service class
- fixing and documenting CVEs
- documenting code

I use two IDEs here: JetBrains IntelliJ for the core development and using VSCode when I need to do complex task with GitHub Copilot

snippet.title: Refactoring Next.JS Component with GitHub Copilot Edits
snippet.description: In this video, we explore how to refactor a Next.js component using GitHub Copilot Edits.

snippet.title: Using GitHub Copilot Edits to add new translation to my NextJS Application.
snippet.description: Adding new entry in my i18n files using Copilot Edits. This new feature of VSCode Copilot Chat allows me to modify multiple files easily.

snippet.title: Internationalization (i18n) with GitHub Copilot
snippet.description: In this video, I show how to use GitHub Copilot Chat to help me to add a new language to a React/NextJS application.

snippet.title: Creating a new GitHub Issue with Copilot Chat
snippet.description: In this demonstration, I use Copilot Chat in VS Code to create a new GitHub Issue and help me to write the specifications.

snippet.title: Explaining Vulnerable Code & Refactoring
snippet.description:
This demonstration shows how to use GitHub Copilot Chat in IntelliJ to check if some code is safe, and also use the chat to refactor the code:
- create new API to access database
- call these new API from a Spring controller

snippet.title: Securing & Refactoring in VSCode with Copilot
snippet.description:
In this demonstration, I use Copilot Chat in VS Code to refactor some code:
- extract all SQL queries database interactions from an API Controller into a new Repository Class
- Rework the SQL Queries when they are not save commenting them with some explanation
- Add Try Catch block in the new code for exception management

snippet.title: Simplifying code with GitHub Copilot
snippet.description:
This short demonstration shows how to simplify some code with Copilot 
- in IntelliJ using right click menu and inline chat
- in VSCode using Chat

snippet.title: Create a TypeScript class from functionnal specifications, in French
snippet.description: In this demonstration, I use VSCode and GitHub Copilot to use a specification, written in French, and create a new TypeScript Class that respects the specifications.

snippet.title: Create a Python script in VSCode using Copilot Inline Chat
snippet.description:
In this demonstration, I use GitHub Copilot Inline Chat in VSCode to create a new Python script that:
- call the GitHub API to get the top 3 repositories of a user/organization
- return the list as text, then refactored to return JSON list

snippet.title: Building function from Spring Boot annotation using Copilot completion in IntelliJ
snippet.description: Creation of a new method through completion, the name, parameters, and code of this function are generated from a simple Spring Boot annotation.

snippet.title: Asking Copilot, in French, how to create and publish container images
snippet.description: This sample show how GitHub Copilot Chat can help a developer to write a workflow.

snippet.title: Moving from Shell to Terraform with GitHub Copilot
snippet.description:
In this demonstration I show how to take a Shell script file that contains many call to the Azure CLI tool (az) to create resources and convert this to a set of Terraform files.

In addition to the convertion from Shell to Terraform with Azure, I am also asking for suggestion for Terraform file for AWS Deployment.

snippet.title: Converting a Spring Boot Java REST class to Python with Flask with Copilot
snippet.description: In this demonstration I am using GitHub Copilot to propose a new implementation of a Java Spring Boot REST Controller in Python with Flask and use SQLAlchemy for the database access

snippet.title: Finding, Explaining, Testing and Fixing Code Vulnerability with GitHub Copilot
snippet.description:
In this demonstration I use GitHub Copilot in IntelliJ to find some vulnerability in a class, this does NOT replace the security control done in your CI/CD platform!)
Once the vulnerabilities found, Copilot explain how to fix it, test the fix.

This is done in a Java Spring Boot Application (Petclinic) in IntelliJ.

snippet.title: Generate new test in VSCode with Copilot
snippet.description: In this demonstration I use GitHub Copilot to create new test, and add test to my existing test.

snippet.title: Generate Documentation and Comments for Typescript function
snippet.description: In this demonstration I use Copilot to add some JavaScript Documentation for a method, and add comments in the code.

snippet.title: Securing & Refactoring in VSCode with Copilot
snippet.description:
In this demonstration, I use Copilot Chat in VS Code to refactor some code:
- extract all SQL queries database interactions from an API Controller into a new Repository Class
- Rework the SQL Queries when they are not save commenting them with some explanation
- Add Try Catch block in the new code for exception management
